title: Number of Sears stores in the United States 2011 - 2017 , by type
summary: This is a multi-line chart with 2 lines representing Full-line stores, and Specialty stores. The y axis denotes Number of stores and the x axis denotes Year.
Overall Specialty stores is rapidly decreasing, Full-line stores is gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Number of stores in descending order is: 1. Full-line stores, and lastly, 2. Specialty stores.
Throughout the period, Full-line stores generally had the highest Number of stores relative to others with an average of 724.86, and it reached its maximum at 2011 with a value of 867.0.
Specialty stores mostly had the least Number of stores with a mean value of 220.71, which peaked at 2011 with a value of 1338.0.
Specialty stores reported the highest Number of stores about 1338.0 in Year 2011
The minimum Number of stores about 23.0, occured at 2017 by Specialty stores.
Specialty stores has decreased by 98.28101644245142 percent.
The greatest difference of Number of stores between Full-line stores and Specialty stores occurs at Year 2012 and the smallest difference occurs at 2011.
